Q_DESC:
Least Recently Used (or LRU) is a page replacement algorithm in which that page is replaced which is least recently used.

For example

Suppose we have page reference string  5 4 3 5 5 2 1 1 2 1 4 3 5 2 1 6 8 9 and 4 empty frames.

Now first page arrives (i.e. 5), it will cause page fault as there was no page in frames. ( 1st page fault ).  Then comes second page (i.e. 4), it was also not found in frames so it will cause a page fault (2nd page fault) and so on.

If a page is referenced and it is already present in frames no page fault will occur. But when a page is referenced and it is not present in the frames then it is allocated the empty frame if present. If there is not an empty frame then a page fault will occur and a page which is least recently used is replaced by the new page.

Input:

6 = Number of pages
1 2 1 3 4 1 = Page reference string
3 = Number of frames
